ai.summary: A 7.4 km moderately challenging woodland circuit in the United Kingdom, weaving through Frith Wood, Summerley and Unstone. The route combines shaded forest paths with occasional open stretches and gentle elevation, suitable for walkers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly compact forest paths and gravel tracks with some grassy footpaths. Expect occasional mud after rain and a few short ascents; surface varies from packed earth to damp leaf litter.
ai.safety_notes: Walk with a map or GPS; keep to marked paths. Watch for uneven ground, roots, and slippery sections after rain. Be mindful of other trail users on shared routes; check weather and daylight hours; pack a small first-aid kit, water, and snacks. Keep an eye out for ticks in wooded areas.
recommended_gear: Map or GPS device / smartphone with offline copy
Hat and sun protection (in sunny weather)
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn are ideal for this hike in the UK; winter can be muddy and shorter daylight hours may affect the route.
